Encrypted Channel: Symmetric Cryptography

Adversaries may employ a known symmetric encryption algorithm to conceal command and control traffic rather than relying on any inherent protections provided by a communication protocol. Symmetric encryption algorithms use the same key for plaintext encryption and ciphertext decryption. Common symmetric encryption algorithms include AES, DES, 3DES, Blowfish, and RC4.

Mitre: T1573.001

This moduel is a wrapper of PyCryptodome That is intendet to simplify its use.

aes256_decrypt(key: bytes, nonce: bytes, ciphertext: bytes, tag: bytes) → bytes[source]

Decrypt AES 256 encrypted data.

Parameters:

  • key (bytes) – key (32 bytes).

  • nonce (bytes) – nonce.

  • ciphertext (bytes) – ciphertext.

  • tag (bytes) – tag.

Returns:

decrypted data.

Return type:

bytes

aes256_encrypt(key: bytes, data: bytes) → Tuple[bytes, bytes, bytes][source]

Encrypt the data via AES256.

Parameters:

  • key (bytes) – The key to use for encryption.

  • data (bytes) – The data to encrypt.

Returns:

nonce, ciphertext, tag

Return type:

Tuple[bytes, bytes, bytes]

gen_aes256_key() → bytes[source]

Generate 32 random bytes for AES256.

Returns:

Random bytes.

Return type:

bytes
